column4: Seriously this is very time critical, please just say some video capture utulities you're aware of for ubuntu
i keep thinking lucview or something like that, but i googled it and thats not it
i mean really anything that will do audio video capture will do.
vlc wont invert the video
i want personal experiance suggestions, or an exhuastive list of video capture software
this is incomprehensible
am i seriously the only person to have ever wanted to record video and audio form a computer?
what in the world good would a silent video be? what am i charlie chaplin?
www.getdeb.net  .. look for LiVeS!
recordmydesktop .. "motion" .. Ubuntu Security Notice Monitor
http://www.google.com/linux?hl=en&q=ubuntu+security+camera+recording&btnG=Search
wont invert, i need ot see the output and i'll look into it
must be 64 bit
won't they work with the 32 bit libs installed?
getdeb only has i386 of lives
looks interesting
it is the best video capture for ubuntu, easily
that's one way to skin a cat :)
is there someway i can share this with people? like put it on a !webcam for the bot or something? because i'm nto kidding it is an awesome application
you can put it on www.ubuntuforums.org and if you can find an appropriate location in the community docs section of the ubuntu website
i'm banned formt eh forums
